meanings.sent1: She always seeks more sophy to understand the world better.
meanings.sent2: His love for reading books shows his thirst for sophy.
meanings.sent3: The wise owl shared its sophy with the curious squirrel.
meanings.sent4: In the library, shelves full of books whispered tales of sophy.
meanings.sent5: The old tree in the forest seemed to hold ancient secrets of sophy within its bark.

meanings.definition: A title used in Persia for a learned man or philosopher
meanings.sent1: The sophy from the East shared his teachings with the villagers.
meanings.sent2: The wise sophy was respected by all for his profound knowledge.
meanings.sent3: The young boy jokingly called his teacher a sophy of mathematics.
meanings.sent4: The sophy's words were like pearls of wisdom scattered among the crowd.
meanings.sent5: People traveled far and wide to seek the counsel of the renowned sophy.
